rice: I want rice, please. → phǒm ao khâaw khráp
sticky rice: I’ll have sticky rice with chicken. → chǎn ao khâaw-nǐaw gàp gài khà
food: The food here is delicious. → aa-hǎan thîi-nîi aròi mâak
dish (with rice): I’d like two dishes with rice. → phǒm ao gàp-khâaw sɔ̌ɔŋ jàan khráp
curry: I like curry. → phǒm chɔ̂ɔp gɛɛŋ
green curry: I’ll order green curry. → chǎn ao gɛɛŋ-khǐaw-wǎan khà
red curry: He eats red curry. → khǎo gin gɛɛŋ-phèt
mild soup: I want mild soup. → phǒm ao gɛɛŋ-jɯ̀ɯt khráp
tom yum soup: We’ll have tom yum soup. → rao ao dtôm-yam
papaya salad: I’ll have papaya salad with sticky rice. → phǒm ao sôm-dtam gàp khâaw-nǐaw khráp
pad thai: I want pad thai. → chǎn ao phàt-thai khà
fried rice: He ordered fried rice. → khǎo sǎng khâaw-phàt
fried vegetables: I’d like fried vegetables without chili. → chǎn khɔ̌ɔ phàt-phàk mâi sài phrík khà
omelet: Can I have an omelet? → khɔ̌ɔ khài-jiaw dâai mái
boiled egg: I want one boiled egg. → phǒm ao khài-dtôm nɯ̀ŋ fâi khráp
fried egg: I’ll take a fried egg. → chǎn ao khài-daaw khà
noodles: Do you have noodles? → mii gǔay-dtǐaw mái
seafood: We love seafood. → rao chɔ̂ɔp aa-hǎan thá-lee
shrimp: I want shrimp fried rice. → phǒm ao khâaw-phàt gûŋ
squid: She eats squid. → thəə gin bplaa-mɯ̀k
crab: I’ll order crab curry. → chǎn ao gɛɛŋ bpuu
chicken: I want grilled chicken. → phǒm ao gài yâaŋ khráp
pork: He likes fried pork. → khǎo chɔ̂ɔp mǔu thɔ̂ɔt
beef: I want beef curry. → chǎn ao gɛɛŋ nʉ́a
duck: We eat roast duck. → rao gin bpèt òp
fish: I want steamed fish. → phǒm ao bplaa nɯ̂ŋ
tofu: She eats tofu. → thəə gin dtâw-hûu
vegetables: I like vegetables. → phǒm chɔ̂ɔp phàk
chili: Don’t add chili, please. → yàa sài phrík khráp
fruit(s): I want some fruit. → chǎn ao phǒn-lá-máay nǐi nɔ̀i
apple: I’ll take one apple. → phǒm ao ɛ́p-pə̂ nɯ̀ŋ lûuk
mango: I want one mango. → chǎn ao má-mûaŋ 1 lûuk khà
banana: He eats a banana. → khǎo gin glûay nɯ̀ŋ lûuk
watermelon: We’ll buy watermelon. → rao sʉ́ʉ dtɛɛŋ-moo
papaya: I want papaya. → phǒm ao má-lá-gɔɔ
pineapple: She likes pineapple. → thəə chɔ̂ɔp sàp-bpà-rót
coconut: I’ll drink coconut juice. → chǎn dʉ̀ʉm náam má-phráaw
grape: I want grapes. → phǒm ao à-ŋùn nɔ̀i khráp
orange: We’ll eat oranges. → rao gin sôm
guava: I’ll buy a guava. → chǎn sʉ́ʉ fà-ràŋ
durian: He eats durian. → khǎo gin thú-rian
longan: I want longan. → phǒm ao lam-yai
mangosteen: She sells mangosteen. → thəə khǎai maŋ-khút
lychee: I’ll try lychee. → chǎn jà thử lín-jìi
dragon fruit: He buys dragon fruit. → khǎo sʉ́ʉ gɛ̂ɛw-maŋ-gɔɔn
jackfruit: I want jackfruit. → phǒm ao khà-nǔn
passion fruit: She eats passion fruit. → thəə gin sǎw-wá-rót
strawberry: I love strawberries. → phǒm chɔ̂ɔp sà-dtrɔɔ-bəə-rîi
cherry: Can I get cherries? → khɔ̌ɔ chəə-rîi dâai mái
boiled: I want boiled vegetables. → phǒm ao phàk dtôm
stir-fried: We’ll order stir-fried pork. → rao ao mǔu phàt
deep-fried: I like deep-fried chicken. → phǒm chɔ̂ɔp gài thɔ̂ɔt
steamed: She wants steamed fish. → thəə ao bplaa nɯ̂ŋ
grilled: I love grilled food. → phǒm chɔ̂ɔp aa-hǎan bpîŋ mâak
grilled (alt.): I love grilled food. → phǒm chɔ̂ɔp aa-hǎan yâaŋ mâak
baked: We eat baked bread. → rao gin khanom bpang òp
